body_html: So I just figured out that doing --config=cuda_clang works, but setting environment TF_CUDA_CLANG=1 with --config=cuda does not. Seems like the solution is to make the latter case work and then the 0/1 for TF_CUDA_CLANG could toggle using nvcc/clang.

body: So I just figured out that doing `--config=cuda_clang` works, but setting environment `TF_CUDA_CLANG=1` with `--config=cuda` does not. Seems like the solution is to make the latter case work and then the 0/1 for `TF_CUDA_CLANG` could toggle using nvcc/clang.
